channel.title: Comments on: Synergy, Leopard and Vista

item.title: By: Zorvy
item.dc:creator: Zorvy
item.description: I am wondering if it is a change in 10.5.6 because I just got a new mini and have the same problem. I can host from the mini with an error, but I cannot get any connection hosting from my vista?
item.content:encoded: I am wondering if it is a change in 10.5.6 because I just got a new mini and have the same problem. I can host from the mini with an error, but I cannot get any connection hosting from my vista?

item.title: By: JEO
item.dc:creator: JEO
item.description:
Hi alll, I have MacBook Leopard 10.5.6 running SynergyKM as a Host and a Win Xp sp3 as a client with synergy 1.3.1. I updated SynergyKm to 1.3.1 as well.
I get the connection refused problem with SynergyKM of using the default port 24800. I tried everything and no luck yet What to do ?? Tks
item.content:encoded:
Hi alll,
I have MacBook Leopard 10.5.6 running SynergyKM as a Host and a Win Xp sp3 as a client with synergy 1.3.1. I updated SynergyKm to 1.3.1 as well.

I get the connection refused problem with SynergyKM of using the default port 24800. I tried everything and no luck yet What to do ?? Tks

item.title: By: Josh
item.dc:creator: Josh
item.description:
I ran into the same problem. I have synergy installed on computers at work and at home and use two separate config files, so I wrote two small shell scripts on my mac (the server) to start the sever inside of a detached screen:
/usr/local/bin/start_synergy_home: screen -dmS synergy_home_server /usr/local/bin/synergys --config /usr/local/etc/synergy-home.conf -f
/usr/local/bin/start_synergy_work: screen -dmS synergy_work_server /usr/local/bin/synergys --config /usr/local/etc/synergy-work.conf -f
At home, I just run start_synergy_home, and at work, I run start_synergy_work, and it loads the proper configs so I'm good to go.
If you need to see the output for some reason, you just do `screen -r synergy_home_server`
Hope it helps someone.
item.content:encoded:
I ran into the same problem. I have synergy installed on computers at work and at home and use two separate config files, so I wrote two small shell scripts on my mac (the server) to start the sever inside of a detached screen:

/usr/local/bin/start_synergy_home:
screen -dmS synergy_home_server /usr/local/bin/synergys –config /usr/local/etc/synergy-home.conf -f

/usr/local/bin/start_synergy_work:
screen -dmS synergy_work_server /usr/local/bin/synergys –config /usr/local/etc/synergy-work.conf -f

At home, I just run start_synergy_home, and at work, I run start_synergy_work, and it loads the proper configs so I’m good to go.

If you need to see the output for some reason, you just do `screen -r synergy_home_server`

Hope it helps someone.

item.title: By: Will
item.dc:creator: Will
item.description: Hey guys, most of what you have been saying is above my level so i apologize but i am having issues, i am trying to use my new vista machine as my server and an imac with leopard as the client via a linksys router. Most settings are comepletely normal. If anyone can point me where to go i would greatly appreciate it.
item.content:encoded: Hey guys, most of what you have been saying is above my level so i apologize but i am having issues, i am trying to use my new vista machine as my server and an imac with leopard as the client via a linksys router. Most settings are comepletely normal. If anyone can point me where to go i would greatly appreciate it.

item.title: By: brenda
item.dc:creator: brenda
item.description:
chris: maybe some more information about your set up would help. I just this got my iMac running as the server and connecting to an Ubuntu server, a Mandrake server and a Windows laptop (one of them through a dmz pinhole on my firewall).
Are you sure your timeout problem isn't due to a firewall issue (mine was).
Have you tried using synergy -f -d DEBUG2 to get more info about what's happening?
item.content:encoded:
chris: maybe some more information about your set up would help. I just this got my iMac running as the server and connecting to an Ubuntu server, a Mandrake server and a Windows laptop (one of them through a dmz pinhole on my firewall).

Are you sure your timeout problem isn’t due to a firewall issue (mine was).

Have you tried using synergy -f -d DEBUG2 to get more info about what’s happening?

item.title: By: chris
item.dc:creator: chris
item.description: Please help me....I simply cannot get synergy to run...I've done everything...I'm getting timeout errors...name errors...errors that haven't even been invented yet.
item.content:encoded: Please help me….I simply cannot get synergy to run…I’ve done everything…I’m getting timeout errors…name errors…errors that haven’t even been invented yet.

item.title: By: Mac Mouse
item.dc:creator: Mac Mouse
item.description: Hi, done a awesome work. Synergy has only been extensively tested on Linux which make the my work more easier. Thank you for the blog posted. The Mac OS X port is incomplete. It does not synchronize the screen saver. Therefore in this case Synergy as helped me a lot with its special features. SynergyKM was previously hosted on a personal server and I decided to move it here in coming week. Hopefully it will give the project more visibility and provide better tools to maintain it. Thank U.
item.content:encoded:
Hi, done a awesome work. Synergy has only been extensively tested on Linux which make the my work more easier. Thank you for the blog posted. The Mac OS X port is incomplete. It does not synchronize the screen saver. Therefore in this case Synergy as helped me a lot with its special features.
SynergyKM was previously hosted on a personal server and I decided to move it here in coming week. Hopefully it will give the project more visibility and provide better tools to maintain it.
Thank U.

item.description: I've been using Teleport which seems rock solid on 10.5.
item.content:encoded: I’ve been using Teleport which seems rock solid on 10.5.

item.title: By: Roger Pack
item.dc:creator: Roger Pack
item.description: Thank you! running synergyc with -f as you suggested makes is so I can use it as a client in leopard. Rock on.
item.content:encoded: Thank you! running synergyc with -f as you suggested makes is so I can use it as a client in leopard. Rock on.
